definition: to suffer defeat in every battle (idiom)
time and again/repeatedly/frequently
to fight/fight/war/battle
time and again/repeatedly/frequently
to defeat/to damage/to lose (to an opponent)/to fail/to wither

sentences.english: The invading army was discomfited in every battle.
sentences.chinese: 那支入侵的軍隊屢戰屢敗。

sentences.english: Few had any faith in his abilities. They were sure he would always fail.
sentences.chinese: 沒有人相信他的能力，他們堅信格蘭特將會屢戰屢敗。

sentences.english: Exporters to the EU often find themselves on the losing side of those judgments.
sentences.chinese: 根據歐盟現行的判斷標準，出口商幾乎是屢戰屢敗。

sentences.english: Perhaps someone failures, frustrated in life.
sentences.chinese: 或許有人屢戰屢敗，人生失意。

sentences.english: The qing dynasty navy often war often hurt, decided to rally the pirates.
sentences.chinese: 清廷水師屢戰屢敗，決定重整旗鼓收拾海盜。

war of words

hoodlum/bad guy

public enemy
harmony is to be prized

lit. the salted fish turns over (idiom)/fig. to experience a reversal of fortune
to force someone to do something
to listen with respectful attention/(a polite request to sb to speak)/we are all ears
variant of 小題大做|小题大做[xiao3 ti2 da4 zuo4]
outward devotion but inner opposition (idiom); to pay lip service/to agree overtly, but oppose in secret
